page.title: 03FARMING EAST OF HEREFORD
page.content: The flood plain of the River Lugg, known locally as the Lugg Flats, dominates the area and a high proportion of the land is water-logged for much of the year or subject to flooding. Land adjacent to the Flats is often steep. A small area of arable land lies between Lugwardine and Withington. Land types determine agricultural practice. Steep slopes and land likely to become wet or flooded is kept under permanent grass. Much of this land is fenced and utilised by beef cattle and some sheep. The arable land carries cereals in rotation with grass leys. Some dairying is practiced here but the Milk Quota System introduced by the EEC has had disastrous consequences on this enterprise for small farmers.
